data.title: Diagnostic hover doing "word-wrap: break-word;" which makes them hard to read
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.10.1 & Insider for Mar 8 2017 
- OS Version: Win 10 RS1

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Install an extension with fairly long diagnostic hovers (an example included below)
2. trigger the diagnostic hover
3. notice that the wrapping of text is breaking words, which makes reading the hover content much more difficult

I'm not entirely certain what to recommend to address this.  For the majority of text it is better to just have the word drop down a line rather than be broken, but for long URLs and such breaking a word is preferable.  I don't know if you can selectively break words by wrapping them in a span with css "word-wrap: break-word;", but if you can a strategy might be to preprocess the hover text and wrap URLs/UNC paths in said span (I don't know what else other than URLs and paths would be long enough that they need to break-word to fit in the hover box).  Alternatively, and this is my preference, you could support links within the hover, so that link text rather than the full URL can be shown.  That both makes it easier for people to access the URL (they could just click on it, instead of copying it out of the hover box and pasting in a browser) and provides a mechanism to show shorter text that doesn't need to be broken up



If you want a diagnostic that reproduces this scenario you can grab and install vscode-devskim-0.1.0.vsix from https://github.com/Microsoft/DevSkim-VSCode-Plugin.  Once installed, create a new .cpp file and type  gets(str); into it - DevSkim will catch the use of gets and add a diagnostic with text long enough that it triggers the undesired wrap conditions

data.title: Feature Request: ability to review 'git push' and compare to remote
data.body:
Hey, I may be missing something but, as for now when I finish coding and had already made some local commits and I'm ready to push changes to remote git branch, I cannot review the changes or even select which files should be pushed. 
Use cases: 
1. Local config files which should be locally committed but not pushed to remote.
2. Not yet ready changes but locally committed files that should not be pushed to remote (yet).
3. Last-minute review and comparison of changes that will be made when pushing (= git diff)

data.title: env variables are not passed to extension host in debug mode
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.11.0
- OS Version: macOS

Trying to pass env variables specified in a launch config to the extension host process fails.

Steps to Reproduce:

- make sure that VS Code Insiders is already running
- open another VS Code window by running the following from the command line:
  ```
  env foo=bar code-insiders <any directory>
  ```
- in that window open the console in chrome dev tools and eval `process.env.foo`

Observe: the env var 'foo' is available and has the correct value.

- open VS Code EH window by running the following from the command line:
  ```
  env foo=bar code-insiders --debugPluginHost=5555 --extensionDevelopmentPath=<path to hello world extension project>
  ```
- in that window open the console in chrome dev tools and eval `process.env.foo`

Observe: the env var 'foo' is undefined

Since in both cases a new window is created, I would expect that the env vars are available in both.

/cc @joaomoreno

data.title: Update Snippets for TypeScript
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.10.1 (1.10.1)
- OS Version: macOS 10.12.3 (16D32)

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Type "import" in a TypeScript file to insert an import statement snippet.
2. this statement uses single quote mark(') instead of double quotemark(").

From TypeScript's source code and tslint recommendations, TypeScript should use double quotes for string.(As mentioned in coding guidelines: https://github.com/Microsoft/TypeScript/wiki/Coding-guidelines).

Please update these snippets to match the guide line.

data.title: window.zoom decimals numbers are not working as expected with zoom in/out
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.10.1
- OS Version: MacOS Sierra

Steps to Reproduce:

Personally, coming from Sublime, the zoom in/out is too much of a jump.  In order to correct that I tried using decimals on the window.zoom setting.  While this does work, it then causes zoom in and out to behave strangely.  Specifically it looks like (in javascript terms) Math.round() is being called prior to zooming with the hotkeys.  In other words, a setting of 1.1 and hitting zoom up sets it to 2, while a setting of 1.6 zoomed up sets it to 3.  This doesn't seem right at all, and also, it doesn't always live update that screen immediately, sometimes you'll need to close the preferences window and reopen.  Let me know if you need more information.

data.title: How about history in search?
Snippet's prefix can't be superset of another prefix
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.10.1 (653f8733)
- OS Version: Windows 10 Pro (10.0.14393)

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Have following user snippets defined
```
{
    "lc": {
        "prefix": "lc",
        "description": "external character",
        "body": [
            "define variable lc${<name>} as character no-undo."
        ]
    },
    "ilc": {
        "prefix": "ilc",
        "description": "define input parameter character",
        "body": [
            "define input parameter ilc${<name>} as character no-undo."
        ]
    }
}
```
2. Have following user settings
```
{
    "editor.tabCompletion": true,
    "editor.quickSuggestions": false,
    "editor.snippetSuggestions": "top"
}
```
3. Try both snippets
- `lc` triggers `lc` snippet
- `ilc` does not work (`tab` does not trigger snippet)
- `xlc` triggers `lc` snippet
4. Delete `lc` snippet
- `ilc` triggers `ilc` snippet

Which is both logical and strange. It is logical, kind of, because in `ilc` it presumably matches both `lc` and `ilc`. It does not show the `lc` in suggestions though. In suggestions it shows only `ilc` and yet it does not expand it on `tab`.

When I, in step 3, use `xlc` and press `Ctrl + Space` to show suggestions, I do not see any. But if I press `Tab`, the `xlc` will expand to `xdefine variable lc${<name>} as character no-undo.` (take notice of the `x` at the beginning). It is strange, because it does not suggest anything, yet it expands.

In all those cases though, it is possible to expand the snippet manually through suggestions window (if populated).

Is this the right behaviour? Is it possible for me to have fully functional both `lc` and `ilc`? I have a lot of snippets from UltiSnips where one prefix is superset of another.

data.title: Align "Amend Commit" with "Smart Commit"

milestone.title: Backlog

data.body:
from @obrejla

Also, explicit Staging of files to amend is a bit clumsy. Most of the time I want to amend all the files I edited. Imho it would be much better if it would behave the same as for common Commit action. So that "everything is part of amending, until something is explicitly staged...then only staged files are part of amending".

data.title: Help Wanted: Test new networking stack

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
If you were pinged to this thread, it's because you helped out in #18103.

With #21879, all network communication was moved to the Chrome's network stack. We'll try to fix the proxy issues over that layer, instead of having two layers.

The latest Insiders release is already out, please give it a try:

- [Windows](https://vscode-update.azurewebsites.net/latest/win32/insider)
- [macOS](https://vscode-update.azurewebsites.net/latest/darwin/insider)
- [Linux 64](https://vscode-update.azurewebsites.net/latest/linux-x64/insider)
- [Linux 32](https://vscode-update.azurewebsites.net/latest/linux-ia32/insider)

Please check whether you can:

1. Browse extensions
2. Install extensions

If stuff fails, please open the dev tools (<kbd>F1</kbd>, `Developer Tools`), try again and check the Network tab for failing requests.

**Note:** The `http.proxy` and `http.proxyStrictSSL` settings are ignored in this build, it doesn't matter what you put in there. The proxy settings are automatically picked up from your system's configuration. So, if stuff fails, the first thing you can check if whether your system is correctly configured to use your proxy.

---

@dfroze @akcorp2003 @fazouane-marouane @ywmail @abargstaedt @liaoya @R3V07T @hbuckle @ocean @joewood @martinmcwhorter @critesjm @dotalchemy @Jule- @diggamies @Efluminor @egamma @the-shank @raphabi @ununseptium @Platzer @williamchang @rfc791 @iamitava @ramdacxp @jrieken @abdinfos @ericc4 @lcrok @wiz @Harpagon @equinoxel @sattlt @nassoman @jithurjacob @sebastienraillet @rafaelcneves @FloMaetschke @JesusSerranoGL @kad @roblourens @leonibr @eolandezhang @xapienz @temurphy @atierant

data.title: More robust deprecation warning for launch.json (Fixes #21946)
data.body: As described in #21946, `"${workspaceRoot}/${command.AskForProgramName}",` and `" ${command.AskForProgramName}",` should trigger a deprecation warning, but the regular expression used was only checking if the `${command.` part was at the start of the string. I changed it to ignore any characters that come before the `${command.` part. This seems to fix the problem for me. Hopefully I'm not missing anything.

data.title: Chords not working when terminal has focus
data.body:
OS X, insiders, zsh shell

1. Open terminal, focus the input
2. Try to execute some keybinding that has a chord (e.g. zen mod `cmd + k z`) - it is not working, notice that the terminal is ignoring the switch to chord mode

The issues seems to be that most terminal clear the terminal with cmd + k or ctrl + k. At least I tried zsh on osx and powershell on win10 and they both have that behavior

data.title: Can't search in symlinked folders
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.10.1
- OS Version: macOS Sierra 10.12.3 (16D32)

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a directory structure a/b/c/
2. Create a file in c/ with content 'testme'
3. Create a symlink d in a/ pointing to c/ (ln -s b/c/ d)
4. Open a/ in VSCode
5. Search a/ for 'testme' - one result returned as expected
5. Search a/d/ for 'testme' - no results returned
